main_definition: Used to describe something that is complete or whole, without any parts missing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Complete or unbroken; undivided or not separated into smaller units.
meanings_and_examples.example: She spent the entire day cleaning her house.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Concerning every part of a particular thing, period, or system.
meanings_and_examples.example: The book covered the entire history of ancient Rome.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Exclusive or devoted to only one person; completely and uniquely for someone.
meanings_and_examples.example: She is my entire world, I can't imagine life without her.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In an amount sufficient to fill the space available.
meanings_and_examples.example: The bakery sold out of all its cakes and pastries entirely by noon.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Without any omissions; complete or in full.
meanings_and_examples.example: He read the entire novel without taking a break.
